entry.title: More Cormorant Fishing・鵜飼い
entry.content:
We went back to Arashiyama last night and rode one of the boats to get this close up shot of the cormorant birds in action.

The fisherman has five cormorant birds on leashes, and watches them in the water. The fire attracts the fish, so the birds can easily catch them.

But why don't the birds eat all the fish? There is a ring, loosely tied around their necks; they can swallow smaller fish but not the larger ones. The fisherman pulls the bird into the boat and disgorges the larger fish from their beak. So the birds get an easy dinner and the fisherman gets the largest ones.

More on this ancient style of fishing on Wikipedia...

entry.title: Moon Viewing on Osawa Ike・観月の夕べ

link.title: Moon Viewing on Osawa Ike・観月の夕べ

entry.content:
Boats glide around the pond at Daikaku-ji, to watch the autumn moon.

A tradition at Osawa Pond, started by Emperor Saga in the 8th Century. There are also ceremonial offerings for a successful harvest.

entry.title: Kyoto National Museum
entry.content: The pool in front of the Heisei Chishinkan Wing of the Kyoto National Museum (京都国立博物館), which opened in 2015. You can also see the entrance gate built when the museum opened in its original late 19th century building (off screen to the left). Kyoto Tower can also be seen in the distance.
